item.title: Binary in Python
item.description: Somehow, I often find myself wanting the binary representation of an integer. Well, Python of course has the builtin bin function, but the output always begins with a pesky 0b. Furthermore, bin doesn’t support padding the binary to a certain length (e.g. 8 bits). So, I use string format: >>> bin(63) '0b111111' >>> '{0:08b}'.format(63) '00111111' Just for fun, here is a somewhat comical and more complicated example for converting an ascii string to binary:
